result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice A Shegonee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property >$5000 - $10,000 or Firearm [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bm).
  • Receiving Stolen Property >$5000 - $10,000 or Firearm [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bm).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 82 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must obtain his high school diploma or equivalent. 

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not have any contact with the victim(s).

The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
The court grants expunction under 973.015 upon successful completion of probation and compliance with all conditions of probation.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as count #1 except no additional community service.
Concurrent with: Count #1

445 days credit as the prison sentence is concurrent.
Concurrent with: Count 1

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 12:06 PM. State - here for sentencing after revocation on both cases. Cveykus - resolved,defendant would be sentenced to 57 months in the WI State Prison System consisting of 27 months of initial confinement followed by 30 months of ES - credit for 445 days, eligible for programs on each count, concurrent to each other. State agrees, makes quick sentencing argument. Cveykus makes argument prior to sentencing, follow joint recommendation. Shegonee makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - 57 months in the WI State Prisopn System consisting of 27 months of initial confinement followed by 30 months of ES, to run concurrent to each other, credit for 445 days on each count cause they are concurrent, court will make him eligible for programs, unpaid fines/costs to be taken from 25% of prision accounts, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 2, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 30, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:17 PM. Also called 14CF97, 15CF73 and 15CF43. State - all matters resolved. Cveykus and Shegonee agree. Cveykus - 14CF61 - amend #1 to receiving stolen property (firearm) contrary to 943.34(1)(bm) (Class H felony), amend #2 to receiving stolen property to 943.34(1)(bm) with same penalties, dismiss and read in remaining counts; 14CF43 - g/nc to counts #1, #2 and #3 as alleged, dismiss and read in remaining counts; 15CF73 - plead g/nc to count #2 and #3 as alleged, dismiss and read in remaining counts; 14CF97 - dismiss and read in entire file; 15CF43 - #1, #2 and #3 - joint of $300 fine plus costs on each count ($831.00 per count); 15CF73 - joint recommenadton of $300 fine plus costs on #2 ($705/$894) and $500 ($1158.00) fine plus costs on count #3 - ask for expungment at end of 2 years for stated reasons; 14CF61 - place on probation for 2 years on each count with conditions of: counseling as deemed appropriate, court costs on each count ($523.00/count), employment/school, $550.00 in restitution including VW surcharge, DA will be asking for jail time on that case with the probation being consecutive to jail time, bond forfeiture to be set aside and used for fines and costs. State has an issue regarding the request for expunction - only if probation is completed successfully. Cveykus - believes the defendant would be eligible for expunction for stated reasons (adjudication as a juvenile). Court responds. Shegonee agrees with resolution as stated by Cveykus. State agrees. Court - 14CF97 - dismissed and read in entirely; 14CF61 - amends count #1 and #2 to receiving stolen property (firearm) contrary to 943.34(1)(bm) - reads new charge and penalty, pleads G to amended counts #1 and #2, Court dismisses and reads in remaining counts (#3 and #4). 15CF73 - Shegonee pleads G to counts #2 and #3 as alleged, dismisses and reads in remaining counts (#1, #4 and #5). 15CF43 - Shegonee pleads G to counts #1, #2 and #3 as alleged, Court dismisses and reads in remaining counts (#4 and #5). Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - has complied with vicrtim notification requirements - makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asking for conditional jail time of 9 months and then 2 years probation on 14CF61, other conditions should include AODA, anger management, restitution, absolute sobriety, no posssesion of alcohol, no entry into any taverns, bars or similar establishments, obtain HS diploma, community service, no contact with the victim in 14CF61. Cveykus makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow recommendation - asking that court not impose jail time for stated reasons - 82 days credit between all cases. Shegonee makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: will allow expungment upon successful completion of probation; 14CF61 - count #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on prbation for 3 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: can petititon for expungement upon successful completion of probation and full satisfaction of all conditions, AODA and follow thru, restitution of $550.00 including VW surcharge - transfer money from 15CF73 and take bond posted, submit DNA sample - given form in Court, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain GED/HSED or equivalent, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service, no contact with the victims, not imposing jail, orders any bond forfeited to remain forfeited (14CF61 - forfeit, 14CF97 - forfeit, 15CF43 - forfeit), costs on each count - take bond posted; 15CF73 - counts #2 and #3 - fine of $1000.00 on each count plus costs and assessment; 15CF43 - counts #1, #2 and #3 - $500 fine plus costs and assessments on each count, grants expunction under 973.015 upon successful completion of probation and compliance of all conditions of probation, right to appeal, no possession firearms, no voting rights, submit DNA sample - given form in Court, refund any bond to poster ($10,000.00), 82 days credit if revoked.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 3:03 PM. Also called 14CF97, 15CF43, 15CF73. State puts off record conversation on the record. Set all matters for JT with the hopes that they will all be resolved, continue bond, and #1 JT will be 15CF43 and 15CF73 for JT on 8/13/15 & 8/14/15. Cveykus and Shegonee agree and has gone over Frye with the defendant. Court adjourns bail bond forfeiture hearing to 8/13/15 as well. Instructed to contact court ASAP if matters are resolved as there are other JT's set for that day.  Jury trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Called 3:19 PM. Also called 15CF73, 14CF61 14CF97 15CF43. State - on 15CF43 & 15CF73 here for PH. In anticipation of a waiver, state has filed information on both cases (both mirror complaint) and the remaining cases here for bail/bond review. Cveykus has had discussions with client and are waiving right to PH. Shegonee agrees. Court goes over PH waiver form and finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intellegintly waiving his right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony may have been committed and binds over for trial. Cveykus is willing to proceed today with ARGN and waives further reading of information filed, enters NG pleas on all counts on both cases. 14CF61 & 14CF97 - State has filed petition to forfeit bond. Cveykus - will be filing objection to forfeiture of bond. Cveykus had just mailed the Brief in Opposition earlier this week and matters will all be heard on July 22, 2015 at 2:30 pm, along with the Final pre-trial for both cases 15CF43 & 15CF73, scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:42 AM. Also called 15CF43, 14CF97, and 15CF73. State - here for AIA on 15CF73 and all other matters are set for STC. Cveykus agrees, has compaint in 15CF73, waives reading, requests PH but waives time limits. Court will consider time limits waived, set 15CF73 and 15CF43 for PH on 6/25/15 at 3:15 PM. Court continues bond on all matters and sets 14CF61 and 14CF97 for JT's on 8/13/15 and 8/14/15 with 14CF61 being #1 JT.  Jury trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's motion for modification of bond
From Judge Stenz to SPD regarding denial of SPD appointment.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:06 AM. Also called 15CF43 and 14CF97. Court reviews files. Shegonee states that he intends to hire another attorney (Hank Schultz). Court instructs defendant on its authority regarding appointing counsel. State - offers are still available if he wishes to plead today. State gives Shegonee another copy of the offer. Court will allow the defendant to review the offers and can re-call it again this afternoon if he so wishes. Court needs Shegonee to obtain something from FCPC informing the Court that he is not eligible to receive any money from them until he officially turns 18. Court continues bond at this point and will set these cases for a hearing once we get confirmation from the tribe. Re-called 2:45 p.m. - Same appearances. Shegonee would like an attorney. Much discussion on getting information from tribe regarding per capita & SPD appointment. Court will contact SPD and schedule after SPD response.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee appears via video from FOSO, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 8:38 a.m. Also called 15CF43 and 14CF97. Defendant is going hire attorney. AIA scheduled case. 14CF61 & 14CF97 - Petition filed by state to forfiet bond, court ordered forfieted, Baid/Bond review is on the calendar. Schedule both cases as STC for same date as AIA. Bond: 14CF61 - state asks for $5000 cash bond. 14CF97 - state asks for total of $3000 cash bond. State makes comment that both cases were scheduled for JT trials. On 15CF43 state asks that bond remain the same, $1000 has been posted. Court orders - 15CF43 - bond continues, conditions are no consumption of alcohol and no contact with AK. Case 14CF61 - $5000 cash bond. Case 14CF97 - $3000 cash bond ($1000 of which is subject to forfieture). Court advises the importance of hiring an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No other appearances. Also called 14CF97. Called 1:44 p.m. Cirilli - filed motion to withdraw as counsel. Cirilli communication and participation does not exist between him and Shegonee and cannot prepare for upcoming trial scheduled. State - no objections. Court grants motion and will sign order allowing Cirilli to withdraw. Court defendant should have appeared and notice was sent. Court orders Bench warrant body or $5000 on each case, take jury trial off court calendar. Court also orders any money posted on either case shall be forfeited. Adjourned.

Shegonee states he wants a different attorney, states he will hire his own attorney, will start looking for an attorney today.
